meanings.definition: To cut or clip with scissors or shears.
meanings.sent1: I will sny the paper to make a snowflake.
meanings.sent2: She always sny the coupons before going shopping.
meanings.sent3: The barber accidentally tried to sny the customer's hair with a comb!
meanings.sent4: She had to sny her long hair to donate it to charity.
meanings.sent5: The tailor expertly used the scissors to sny the fabric into shape.

meanings.definition: A sudden, sharp sound, as of a twig snapping.
meanings.sent1: The hiker heard a loud sny in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The sny of the branch made her jump in surprise.
meanings.sent3: The sny of the rubber band echoed in the quiet room.
meanings.sent4: The sny of the door closing signaled the end of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The sudden sny of the balloon popping startled everyone at the party.

meanings.sent1: The cat squeezed through the sny between the fences.
meanings.sent2: The old town had many hidden snys and alleys.
meanings.sent3: The children loved playing hide-and-seek in the dark sny.
meanings.sent4: The sny behind the building was a shortcut to the market.
meanings.sent5: The detective followed the suspect into the narrow sny to catch him.
